DataElement.preferredName: Specimen Microarray Copy Number Description Type
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the explanation for the result of molecules numbers on or in a cell or part of a cell. Usually applied to specific genes or to plasmids within a bacterium.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to the explanation of the number of molecules of a DNA fragments on or in a cell or part of a cell. Usually applied to specific genes or to plasmids within a bacterium.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Specimen; a bit of tissue or blood or urine that is taken or used for research purposes.

Concepts.definition: A part of a thing, or of several things, taken to demonstrate or to determine the character of the whole, e.g. a substance, or portion of material obtained for use in testing, examination, or study; particularly, a preparation of tissue or bodily fluid taken for examination or diagnosis.

Property.preferredDefinition: A piece of glass or plastic on which different samples have been affixed at separate locations in an ordered manner thus forming a microscopic array.  The samples are usually DNA fragments but may also be antibodies, other proteins, or tissues.:The number of molecules of a particular type on or in a cell or part of a cell. Usually applied to specific genes or to plasmids within a bacterium.:A written or verbal account, representation, statement, or explanation of something.

Concepts.definition: A piece of glass or plastic on which different samples have been affixed at separate locations in an ordered manner thus forming a microscopic array.  The samples are usually DNA fragments but may also be antibodies, other proteins, or tissues.
The number of molecules of a particular type on or in a cell or part of a cell. Usually applied to specific genes or to plasmids within a bacterium.
A written or verbal account, representation, statement, or explanation of something.

DataElementConcept.origin: COG CRF:Children's Oncology Group Case Report Form

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The examination result of the number of molecules of a particular type on or in a cell or part of a cell.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Having naturally dividable parts; divided into sections with each section adjacent to the other.: genetic phenomenon due to deletion or mutation in one allele of a polymorphic gene, as detected by expression after cell fusion; used as a test for tumor-promoting mutations; do not confuse with "loss of heterogeneity" which applies to diverse cell populations within a tissue.

Concepts.definition: Having naturally dividable parts; divided into sections with each section adjacent to the other.

A genetic variation where gain, loss, or exchange of DNA results in monoallelic loss of function mutations in a diploid cell. In the context of tumor suppressor genes, where a single copy is sufficient for functionality, loss of function for the second allele is associated with tumorigenesis.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Including all components without exception; constituting the full amount or extent or duration; complete.: The portion of the upper extremity between the shoulder and the elbow. For clinical purposes this term is also used to refer to the whole superior limb.: genetic phenomenon due to deletion or mutation in one allele of a polymorphic gene, as detected by expression after cell fusion; used as a test for tumor-promoting mutations; do not confuse with "loss of heterogeneity" which applies to diverse cell populations within a tissue.

Concepts.definition: Including all components without exception; constituting the full amount or extent or duration; complete.
The portion of the upper extremity between the shoulder and the elbow. For clinical purposes this term is also used to refer to the whole superior limb.

A genetic variation where gain, loss, or exchange of DNA results in monoallelic loss of function mutations in a diploid cell. In the context of tumor suppressor genes, where a single copy is sufficient for functionality, loss of function for the second allele is associated with tumorigenesis.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Including all components without exception; constituting the full amount or extent or duration; complete.: The portion of the upper extremity between the shoulder and the elbow. For clinical purposes this term is also used to refer to the whole superior limb.: A gradual decline in amount or activity.
